5.title: Colour Switcher
5.content: Colour SwitcherWIP  Matching the colours of an image to the NFB palette  RequirementsMatching the colours of an image to the NFB paletteOne of the characteristic of the Balmoral Style is having interface element that match the colour of images. For example, the “Eyecon” in the background of the NFB.ca homepage always match the (dominant) colour of the main feature image.How it works: We analyse the color of an image to extract the dominant colour then this colour is match to the closest colour from the NFB Palette.Here is how to change the colour of a css property so that it matches the colour of any image.First, add the .is-switch-color class and add the following parameters:            property      values      description                  data-switchColorIdImg             The id of the image we want to use to define the colour              data-switchColorCssProperty      color, background-color      The css property to change              data-switchColorType      brandColor, dominantColor      The colour selection mode              data-switchColorTextElement      HEX Colour      optional Force a specific colour for overlay texts      &lt;img src="myImage.jpg" id="myImageID"&gt;&lt;button type="button" class="btn is-switch-color " data-switchcoloridimg="myImageID" data-switchcolorcssproperty="background-color" data-switchcolortype="brandColor"&gt;Matching color button!&lt;/button&gt;Matching NFB colourRequirementsThis functionality needs the following scripts:  jquery-2.1.1.min.js  preloadjs-0.6.1.min.js  color-thief.min.js  tinycolor.js  m-switch-color.js

12.title: Layout
12.content: Layout  Grid  Breakpoint  Layout          X-small      Small      Medium      X-large        Content area  Page wide sectionGridLe site utilise la grille responsive mobile-first en 12 colonnes de bootstrap. Ainsi que son système de medias queries. Un media query (@screen-xl-min) ainsi que les classes associées (.col-xl-) ont été ajoutés pour les grandes résolutions. Consultez la documentation de bootstrap pour plus d’informations sur l’utilisation de la grille.The site uses a mobile-first, 12  columns responsive grid based on Bootstrap (3.4), It also uses Bootstrap’s system of medias queries. A media query ( @screen-xl-min ) and associated classes (.col-xl-) have been added for large resolutions. See the bootstrap documentation for more information on using this grid.Breakpoint            break point      media query      description                  Default             Mobile first! Phone to small tablets              768px      @media (min-width: @screen-sm-min) {}      For small tablets or tablets in portrait format.              990px      @media (min-width: @screen-md-min) {}      For small computers or tablets in landscape format.              1200px      @media (min-width: @screen-lg-min) {}      Regular computers.              1440px      @media (min-width: @screen-xl-min) {}      Large screen computers and TVs tv. 13.content: Alerts &amp; Messages  Colours and status levels  Message with choicesMessage banners are displayed at the top of a page. Just insert the following code in a  &lt;% block name = "ribbon"&gt; &lt;/% block&gt; of the template. The x button uses the html element hiding utility.Les bandeaux d’alerte s’affiche dans le haut d’une page. 16.title: Style definition
16.content: Online platforms style definition  Colors themes  Eyecons  Fonts  DashThe NFB platform style is defined by the following objects :  A palette of 8 colours  The NFB eyecon  A short horizontal dash  Ciutadella &amp; Suisse fontColors themesA color theme is site or page specific. A color can be chosen for an entire site or be set dynamically depending on pages content.Dynamic themes are selected based on the dominant image on a page.The colors should not be used to identify the sections of a website. Color themes should not be meaningful in terms of a site’s architecture.Themes are monochromatic. Only one color should be used on a page main content.The object that can be colored are :  Eyecons  Short dash  Buttons &amp; links  Article leads  Play buttonNever use the NFB colours on :  NFB logo  body textEyeconsEyecons must always be placed flush to the edge of the page or of en interface element. There can be multiple eyecons on a page.Eyecons should not be burned into images.FontsCiutadella is the sans-serift font used on the interface of the site (navigation, buttons and cards.The Suisse font (serif) is used on text blocks.Ciutadella Bold All Caps can be used as a ‘display style’ as a main header on the top of a page. Only once per page.DashThe dash can be used as a divider to mark the begining or theend of a block.It cans also be combine with text (Ciutadella bold) to recreate the signature titles of NFB advertising. In this context, the width of the dash should match the size of the font (the width of a character’s stroke)
